dict.string: Monday, February 9, 2009 Knowledge Representation 4 Properties Representational Adequacy you can represent anything that is relevant to a particular activity Inferential Adequacy knowledge is in a form that can be combined with other knowledge, take us closer to the goal of our knowledge Inferential Efficiency get to goal without getting bogged down in exponential explosion of data Acquisitional Efficieny as you acquire more knowledge, does it scale? Simple Representations State Variables O-A-V (object - attribute - value) can't infer new facts Predicate Logic Semantic Nets & Conceptual Graphs deals with objects and their relationships Bob beat up Frank because he stole Bob's sister's Algebra notebook. Schank's Conceptual Dependency - page 236 more structure than semantic net, less ad-hoc Consists of: ACTs - actions (from list) - predefined PPs - picture producers (nouns, objects) - ad-hoc AAs - action aiders (modifiers of actions, adverbs) - ad-hoc PAs - picture aiders (modifiers of objects, adjectives) - ad-hoc mode/tense - conditional, occurred in past, has dependency relationship arrows Scripts
